definition: aspect particle indicating action in progress
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
lit. to stare at the ceiling while writing a book (idiom); to put one's whole body and soul into a book

sentences.english: Nanjing had one book published by the whole "Kai Li line synchronous training 1000 cases".
sentences.chinese: 寧一全曾著書出版《楷隸行同步練千例》。

sentences.english: Writing books is a form signifying the establishment of a scholar's own theoretical system.
sentences.chinese: 著書立說是學者們形成自己理論體系的一個表現形式。

sentences.english: Finally the Ambassador quoted Lord Patten of Barnes in his book entitled What Next?
sentences.chinese: 最後，劉大使引用彭定康校長的著書《下步如何？

sentences.english: What's more, wrote books to advocate the western culture.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他還著書立說，積極宣揚西方文化。

sentences.english: It was probably the highest honorarium ever received by an author for writing a book.
sentences.chinese: 可能是史上，一介作者著書所獲的最大報酬。

sentences.english: Publications include over 50 papers and 3 books and 3 software copyrights.
sentences.chinese: 發表論文50多篇，著書3部，獲軟件著作權6項。

sentences.english: Written cultural transmission was mainly writing books.
sentences.chinese: 書面文化的主要傳播方式是著書立說。

definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to comment/to talk about/to discuss/discussion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
